subject: Education
title: Standardized Testing: From Army Sorting to School Sorting
description: A quick, practical guide to Standardized Testing: From Army Sorting to School Sorting.

hook.text: The SAT descends from an IQ test designed to sort soldiers in World War I.

buildup.text: Army Alpha tests ranked recruits quickly. Educators saw potential for sorting students too.

discovery.text: Standardized tests promised objectivityâ€”one score, same for everyone, no bias.

twist.text: The tests reflected the biases of their creators and the experiences of privileged groups.

climax.text: Testing became so central that schools now teach to the test, not through it.

punchline.text: A tool for sorting became a tool for defining who matters.

quiz.question: What was the original purpose of standardized tests?
options: Sorting military recruits quickly during wartime
